title: 3 Simple Ways to Add a Dotted Line in a Word Document

steps.title: Open a project in Microsoft Word.
steps.content: Open a project in Microsoft Word. This looks like a W on top of a blue square. Microsoft Word is available to install for Windows and Mac . You must have a subscription to use Office 365.

steps.title: Place your cursor where you want your line to appear.
steps.content: Place your cursor where you want your line to appear. You'll need to be on a blank line, as this won't work if there is text before or after your cursor on the same line. You'll be creating a horizontal line that spans from one edge of your page to the other. The line will stop at your set margins. If you want to make the line span the whole page, you'll need to change your document margins .

steps.title: Type three asterisks (*) in a row.
steps.content: Type three asterisks (*) in a row. Hold down Shift and press 8 on the number row at the top of your keyboard to create an asterisk. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Press ↵ Enter to convert the dashes into a line.
steps.content: Press ↵ Enter to convert the dashes into a line. AutoCorrect will automatically create a dotted line. If you don't have AutoCorrect enabled, do so by clicking File → Options → Proofing → AutoCorrect Options… . This will open a new window. Make sure the Border Lines box is checked. This can be found underneath Apply as you type . If you want to turn off AutoCorrect , uncheck the boxes.

steps.title: Use different characters for different line styles (optional).
steps.content: Use different characters for different line styles (optional). You can create different lines by using characters other than the dash. Thin line : Three hyphens (-). Thick line : Three underscores (_). Double line : Three equal signs (=). Triple line : Three pound signs (#). Squiggly line : Three tildes (~).

steps.title: Open a project in Microsoft Word.
steps.content: Open a project in Microsoft Word. This looks like a W on top of a blue square. Microsoft Word is available to install for Windows and Mac. [2] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source You must have a subscription to use Office 365.

steps.title: Click the Insert tab.
steps.content: Click the Insert tab. This tab is in the blue ribbon at the top of the Word window, between Home and Draw . [3] X Research source

steps.title: Click Shapes.
steps.content: Click Shapes . It's in the Insert toolbar, next to the icon of an overlapping circle and square. [4] X Research source A drop-down menu will appear.

steps.title: Select a line shape.
steps.content: Select a line shape. In the "Lines" heading, click one of the line templates. You can choose a line, line arrow, double line arrow, and more. These lines can be adjusted to be dotted later. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Draw your line.
steps.content: Draw your line. Click and drag across the document to create your line. [6] X Research source If you need to adjust the line's length and orientation, click the left or right circle. Drag it left or right to adjust the length, or drag it up and down to adjust the orientation. To move the line, double-click and drag it to the desired position.

steps.title: Double-click the line.
steps.content: Double-click the line. You'll be taken to the Shape Format tab.

steps.title: Click Shape Outline.
steps.content: Click Shape Outline . This will be in the Shape Styles section. A drop-down menu will open.

steps.title: Click Dashes.
steps.content: Click Dashes . The menu will expand.

steps.title: Select a dash style.
steps.content: Select a dash style. You can choose from the available presets or click More Lines to customize your own in the Format Shape panel. In the Format Shape panel, you can adjust the color, transparency, width, and more.

steps.title: Open a document in the Microsoft Word app.
steps.content: Open a document in the Microsoft Word app. This looks like a blue notebook next to a W . Microsoft Word is available for iOS in the App Store and for Android in the Google Play Store . Tap Blank document to open a new document or tap a file to open an existing document.

steps.title: Tap the "Edit" icon at the top.
steps.content: Tap the "Edit" icon at the top. It's on the blue toolbar at the top. This will open the editing menu in the bottom half of your screen. On iPhone/iPad , this button looks like a white " A " and a pencil icon on the blue toolbar. On Android , you may find the same icon or just a white pencil.

steps.title: Tap the Home button.
steps.content: Tap the Home button. It's in the upper-left corner of the toolbar menu at the bottom. This will open your toolbar tabs.

steps.title: Select Insert on the toolbar menu.
steps.content: Select Insert on the toolbar menu. This will open the available options.

steps.title: Select Shape.
steps.content: Select Shape . This will open a menu with all the available shapes you can add.

steps.title: Select the type of line you want to add.
steps.content: Select the type of line you want to add. This will add the selected line to your document. You can add dots to your line later.

steps.title: Drag the blue end-points of the line to adjust the line (optional).
steps.content: Drag the blue end-points of the line to adjust the line (optional). Adjust the size and position of your line from the blue dots on both ends of the shape. You can also do this after adding dots to your line.

steps.title: Tap Shape Style on the Shape menu.
steps.content: Tap Shape Style on the Shape menu. This will open all the available styles for your line.

steps.title: Select a dotted style.
steps.content: Select a dotted style. This will turn the selected line into a dotted line. You can size and position it however you want.
